text: Well, I was at work one day I was doing my usual job working on the warehouse floor
keypoint: Arrives at work, doing usual warehouse duties
Stocking boxes and organizing merchandise on shelves

text: I had been working for a few hours it was getting late
keypoint: After hours pass, night approaches in warehouse

text: I had been feeling a bit strange a bit lightheaded but chalked it up to hunger not having eaten yet that day
keypoint: Feels lightheaded, blames hunger from skipping meals

text: But then, as I was walking around the warehouse returning items to their proper places I started to feel a strange tightness and pressure in my chest
keypoint: Walking aisles, sudden chest tightness and pressure strikes

text: I stopped what I was doing leaned against a nearby wall for a bit the pressure only got stronger I could feel my heart pounding in my chest
keypoint: Stops work, leans on wall as pressure worsens

text: Next thing I know, I started seeing spots I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead my arms I tried to take some deep breaths
keypoint: Vision spots, sweating, attempts deep breathing for relief

text: I just couldn't catch my breath I was really scared didn't know what to do.
keypoint: Unable to breathe, scared and uncertain what to do

text: Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse. It was the manager who had seen me called out to me
keypoint: Manager notices distress and calls across warehouse

text: it seems someone had noticed me was checking to see if I was alright
keypoint: Realizes someone checking on his condition

text: I tried to yell back that something was wrong I couldn't find my voice.
keypoint: Tries to respond, but voice fails entirely

text: The manager started walking towards me I could feel my world going dark I started to drop to the ground luckily the manager got to me in time
keypoint: Manager reaches him as darkness falls and he collapses

text: caught me just before my legs gave out
keypoint: Manager catches him before his legs give out

text: He took me to the staff room sat me down in a chair He asked me questions about what was wrong what happened
keypoint: Manager brings him to staff room, questions situation

text: He got me a glass of cold water told me to rest for a bit
keypoint: Provides cold water, instructs him to rest

text: After a few minutes the pressure in my chest slowly eased up I started to feel better
keypoint: After resting, chest pressure eases and wellbeing returns

text: It turned out I had been having a panic attack I escaped from the situation the help of the quick action of the manager
keypoint: Learns it was panic attack; manager’s quick action helped

text: It was never a fun experience it really could have been much worse
keypoint: Reflects on scary experience that could’ve been worse

text: it taught me to check in with myself make sure to properly rest eat to avoid further episodes
keypoint: Lesson learned to rest and eat to prevent episodes
